title: Ticket #6822: Configure sshd to more secure for condor_ssh_to_job
description:
Config the sshd used be condor_ssh_to_job to be more secure. This work is driven by people using HTCondor on FIPS 140-2 compliant systems.

Note: by changing the Ciphers and MACs settings for sshd to be FIPs compliant, condor_ssh_to_job will fail from submit hosts running RHEL5 or earlier. This seems acceptable considering that HTCondor has not supported RHEL5 since v8.2, and we do not ensure compatibility between HTCondor v8.2.x and v8.8.x.
remarks:
2018-Nov-20 17:02:46 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Commit needs documentation, so changing ticket to doc pending.

Also as part of the code review I made some changes in commit [55795] :

  1. Setting ClientAlive settings to timeout an idle session in 10 minutes seems like it would break the semantics expected by users. Note that condor_submit -interactive already sets an idle limit via bash's TMOUT environment variable.
  2. Added additional comments / references in the file.
  3. Set Compression to be delayed instead of just always no, which is still FIPs compliant.
